definition: foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks

sentences.english: No man loves his fetters be they made of gold.
sentences.chinese: 即使脚镣黄金铸，无人爱上这刑具。

sentences.english: Whose feet they hurt with fetters: he was laid in iron
sentences.chinese: 人用脚镣伤他的脚，他被铁链捆拘。

sentences.english: Doctrine to a fool is as fetters on the feet, and like manacles on the right hand.
sentences.chinese: 纪律为愚昧人，就如脚镣，和右手上的手铐。

sentences.english: The prisoner's ankle chains clanked as they walked.
sentences.chinese: 犯人走路时脚镣叮当作响。

sentences.english: It shackles our ability to think and pursue true happiness.
sentences.chinese: 它是手铐脚镣，阻止你去追求真正的幸福。

sentences.english: Jingyuan then asked Yu Xianyang to open handcuffs shackles, Pelle had to do.
sentences.chinese: 静远随即要求打开俞显扬的手铐脚镣，小秋只得照办。
那个罪犯被戴上了脚镣手铐。

sentences.english: They bruised his feet with shackles, his neck was put in irons
sentences.chinese: 人用脚镣伤他的脚，他被铁链捆拘。

sentences.english: No man loves his fetters, be they made of gold.
sentences.chinese: 金铸的脚镣，也没人喜爱。

sentences.english: Iron fetters are fastened on the legs of murderers and inveterate burglars.
sentences.chinese: 对杀人犯和惯偷惯盗，则使用铁质脚镣。

definition: to bind a person's upper body, with arms tied behind the back and rope looped around the neck/to truss up
